intro: Stachys janiana, commonly known as the Armenian betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are clustered in whorls, forming dense spikes of violet to purple hues, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Stachys janiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses in local herbal practices.
